Nothing, it won't work at all (they'll just go back to how they were), vfat doesn't support UNIX permissions.
then how do I give another user access to these files?
You need to mount the partition with the right umask
I don't know how to do that with truecrypt :(

Truecrypt desu? Okay, well. You need to tick "do not mount" when mounting the truecrypt partition (ridiculous, I know) and then mount it like you normally would, it will be located in "/dev/mapper/truecrypt1" or somesuch.
and then what. mount that file again as usual?
Yeah, sudo mount -t vfat -o defaults,umask=... /dev/mapper/truecrypt1 /mnt
This might of interest you: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/TrueCrypt#Mount_volumes_via_fstab
that won't work. if I change the ownership to www-data then I can not write to it within Netbeans
Who said anything about changing ownership?
what is the umask code for rwxrwxrwx?
Or that.
thanks, it works :-)

umasks are confusing lol :/
in truecrypt->settings->mount options , I put in umask=0.  this worked :-)
